title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Border Security Program

description.narrative: The objective of this program is to increase Lebanons capability to monitor its northeastern border with Syria through improved communication among its border units while conducting CT operations. Equipment provided includes communications equipment.

title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - CIDT and Counterterrorism Operations Training Program - Phase II

description.narrative: To conduct or support programs providing training and equipment to national security forces of foreign countries for the purpose of building capacity of partner nations. title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Rotary Wing CAS

description.narrative: To conduct or support programs providing training and equipment to national security forces of foreign countries for the purpose of building capacity of partner nations. The Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) provides program management. Country teams work through DoD geographic Combatant Commands (COCOMs).

title.narrative: Training of security forces to promote respect for rule of law and human rights under Sec. 1206 of the National Defense Authorization Act

description.narrative: This program provides training for security forces and associated security ministries of foreign countries to promote respect for rule of law and human rights, in accordance with current Leahy human rights provisions of Section 1206 of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA).

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Counternarcotics and Global Threats: Lebanon - Lebanon Armed Forces Counter-Illicit Drug Operations Training Phase 1

description.narrative: The Office of the Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Counternarcotics and Global Threats develops DoD counterdrug (CD) and counter-transnational organized crime (CTOC) policy. It also issues guidance, establishes priorities, and oversees resource allocation and program execution, for DoD CD and CTOC missions. These missions focus on countering illicit drug trafficking, but also include countering illicit financial flows and the illicit trafficking of people, wildlife, natural resources, and weapons. Primary activities include: coordinate and monitor DoD and interagency efforts for the detection and monitoring of the maritime and aerial transit of illegal drugs into the United States; direct, oversee, and monitor planning, programming, and budget (formulation, justification, and execution) processes for DoD Drug Interdiction and CD Activities programs, in coordination with other DoD Components; review, evaluate, coordinate, and monitor DoD CD and CTOC plans and programs to ensure adherence to approved policy and standards.

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Lebanon - Defense Institution Building Project #5. Meet with and support the Capability Development Plan (CDP) Update Committee, Capability Cost Estimation Committee, Materiel, Acquisition, and Management Committee, Headquarters Improvement Cell, Logistics Brigade Improvement Cell, Logistics Redesign Cell, LAF ERP Committee, Infrastructure Committee, Bradley Operations Integration Committee, Bradley Logistics Integration Committee, Ammunition Requirements Capability Committee (including Operational Ammunition Work Group), Training Ammunition Sub-Committee, MD530G Capabilities Development and Integration Committee ongoing projects in support of the Lebanese Armed Forces (LAF) Defense Institution Building (DIB) Project.
